data.title: three related bug fixes in FontAtlas::prepareLetterDefinitions
data.body:
I found four bugs in FontAtlas::prepareLetterDefinitions in version 3.8.1

One of those bugs has already been fixed, in commit bae36b7a98dc27d68ce1aa690d9ef30516671692

This branch contains fixes for the other three bugs:
1) _currLineHeight shouldn't be updated until after we've checked for overflow
2) the check for vertical overflow should include _letterPadding and _letterEdgeExtend, which can make the line higher than _lineHeight
3) _currLineHeight should be used instead of _lineHeight when updating the texture, since it might be greater than _lineHeight

These bugs, and the one already fixed, all lead to previous letter textures being partially overwritten by new letter textures. The bugs are triggered when the letter that causes a horizontal overflow is taller than any letter that follows it before the next horizontal overflow.

Note that the order that letters are rendered in is determined by key iteration over an unordered_map, so it is hard to predict.

data.title: js bindings android Segmentation Fault Facebook Plugin
data.body:
This is the call from js code:

plugin.FacebookAgent.getInstance().api("/me/apprequests", plugin.FacebookAgent.HttpMethod.GET, function (code, response) {cc.log(JSON.stringify(response))}):

It crashes only in android and not in ios. In order to reproduce it do 3-5 subsequent .api calls.
I'm using cocos2d-js 3.10 with NDK r10c.

Here is the call stack for the seg fault:

`js::jit::AutoFlushICache::AutoFlushICache() at 0x9fa91050  
js::jit::BaselineCompiler::compile() at 0x9fa1d484  
js::jit::BaselineCompile() at 0x9fa53014    
js::jit::CanEnterBaselineMethod() at 0x9fa53224 
js::RunScript() at 0x9fce23c8   
js::Invoke() at 0x9fce258c  
js::Invoke() at 0x9fce2fc0  
JS_CallFunctionValue() at 0x9fbb5f98    
pluginx::JSFunctionWrapper::invoke() at jsb_pluginx_basic_conversions.cpp:81 0x9f86fc84 
__lambda14::operator() at jsb_pluginx_manual_callback.cpp:952 0x9f87dc10    
std::_Function_handler<void(int, std::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >&), js_pluginx_FacebookAgent_api(JSContext*, uint32_t, jsval*)::__lambda14>::_M_invoke at functional:2,071 0x9f88259c    
std::function<void (int, std::string&)>::operator()(int, std::string&) const at functional:2,471 0x9f8cca5c 
cocos2d::plugin::Java_org_cocos2dx_plugin_UserFacebook_nativeRequestCallback() at FacebookAgent.cpp:43 0x9f8d0344   
0xa1ec05c8  
`

data.title: error while loading shared libraries: libfmod.so.6 in Debian
data.body:
OS: Debian 8
version: cocos2d-x-3.10

> $: unzip cocos2d-x-3.10
> $ : ./build/install-deps-linux.sh
> $:  ./steup.py
> $: source ~/.bashrc
> $: cocos run -s ./tests/ccp-tests/ -p linux

when I build over I got this error:

> /home/zhe/Documents/PoolGame/simulator/linux/MyGame: error while loading shared libraries: libfmod.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
> Error running command, return code: 127.

I did anything I can. 

> cp ./external/linux-specific/fmod/prebuilt/64-bit/libfmodL.so /usr/local/lib/
> cp ./external/linux-specific/fmod/prebuilt/64-bit/libfmod.so /usr/local/lib/
> 
> ln -s /usr/local/lib/libfmod.so /usr/local/lib/libfmod.so.6
> ln -s /usr/local/lib/libfmodL.so /usr/local/lib/libfmod.soL.6

execute install-deps-linux.sh again and again.
but it still error. somebady can help me?

data.title: Closes websocket connection by dispatching a 'resetDirector' event.
Add language localization support for Button, Text, TextField and TextBMFont.
data.body: @xiaofeng11 @pandamicro

data.title: Fix typos in CCRenderTexture.cpp comments
data.body: Qualcomm Andreno GPU -> Adreno GPU

data.title: Remove unnecessary const from return types
data.body:
When compiling libcocos2d with GCC on Linux, it will always show warning messages below:

```
cocos/2d/CCAutoPolygon.h:104:39: warning: type qualifiers ignored on function return type [-Wignored-qualifiers]
cocos/2d/CCAutoPolygon.h:110:44: warning: type qualifiers ignored on function return type [-Wignored-qualifiers]
cocos/2d/CCAutoPolygon.h:113:67: warning: type qualifiers ignored on function return type [-Wignored-qualifiers]
cocos/2d/CCAutoPolygon.h:119:27: warning: type qualifiers ignored on function return type [-Wignored-qualifiers]
cocos/2d/CCSprite.h:477:33: warning: type qualifiers ignored on function return type [-Wignored-qualifiers]
cocos/renderer/CCGLProgram.h:492:38: warning: type qualifiers ignored on function return type [-Wignored-qualifiers]
...
```

In C/C++, const qualifiers on function return types are indeed superfluous. It will also trigger the warning when compiling with option `[-Wignored-qualifiers]`.
So this pull request removes unnecessary `const` from return types and fixes them.

Thank you for your time and attention.

data.title: Request for createWithXML() of RichText
data.body:
- I want to set the default value.
  - color
  - font size
  - font face
- I want to set values (color, size, face, etc) of the font in the A tag.
- I want to extend the hyperlink. For example, the callback can be registered.
  - For example, I want to go to the scene.
- I want to add own tags.

data.title: Add "-use-local-script" command param.
data.body: Add "-use-local-script" command param to control whether to load javascript  files from simulator local directory.

data.title: Fails on linking android application.
data.body:
In 3 version from git repository build and run for linux and win32 platforms is correct.

But, build for android:

$ cocos new FirstApp -p com.my.cocos.firstapp -l cpp -d projects
$ cd projects/FirstApp
$ cocos run -p android -j 4
. . .
[armeabi] SharedLibrary  : libcocos2dcpp.so
/home/opt/cocos2d-x/projects/FirstApp/proj.android/../cocos2d/cocos/./base/CCDirector.cpp:981: error: undefined reference to 'cocos2d::network::WebSocket::closeAllConnections()'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make: **\* [obj/local/armeabi/libcocos2dcpp.so] Error 1
make: Leaving directory `/home/opt/cocos2d-x/projects/FirstApp/proj.android'

data.title: Allow Sprite3D::setTexture to specify texture usage
data.body: Allow a texture usage to be specified for Sprite3D::setTexture (as it can for Mesh::setTexture)

data.title: Init ui::TabControl
data.body: Init ui::TabControl

data.title: Add program-generated geometry test case
data.body: Add a small test case showing how Sprite3D can support displaying of geometry which has been generated by the program at run-time, instead of loading a predetermined model.

data.title: Slots v3
data.body: Fix an issue of AssetManagerEx that download progress freezes when only files are deleted from remote.

data.title: Provide flatbuffer schemes for custom edit?
data.body: There's a lots of generated code in cocos2dx for serialization, such as CSParseBinary_generated.h. The generated protocol is not full and complete, and we need to update them for making advanced prefabs. But I can not find the flatbuffer schemes, should cocos2dx provide these schemes?

data.title: added methods to set individual components of velocity of a PhysicsBody
Add cocostudio localization editor export data parser and demo
added ability to set individual components of velocity to PhysicsBody
Add 'trap' command to the CCConsole
Can't resume application by CCConsole on iOS.
data.body:
Can't resume application by `director start` after executing `director stop` command on CCConsole.
`director pause` and `director resume` pair is too.
`Director::mainLoop` is never called after executing `director start`.
This probrem is recoverable by going to background(taskmgr) once.

Both  iPhone and iOS simulator have that problem. (XCode7, iOS 9)

data.title: Added command lines of building a Android project
data.body:
It's weird to build and run a Android project with command line as followed
`$ cocos run -p android -j 4`
It seems didn't work for me.
I prefer to use Android Studio when I try to build a Android project,and I can only build it and import it to Android Studio and run successfully with those command lines I added.
So I think that those command lines should be showed directly to who need them.
